article: Long ago, the first travellers went to Ireland from Scotland, and later from the south and west of Europe. They found that much of the _ was poor. But there was enough grass for sheep and cows, because it rained so much. The seas around _ were full of all sorts of fish. Many of the _ were very poor. They _ mainly on potatoes. Around 1850, a terrible disease _ the potato crop, and potatoes went bad in the soil. Tens of thousands of people died of hunger. Many had to _ Ireland and travelled to Britain or to North America to look for a better _ . Although many _ became separated , people still kept in touch with each other. Today, life has _ for the population, although many farmers in the west _ to lead a simple life. Most Irish people go to _ every Sunday and the church plays an _ part in people's lives. The Irish are very _ of music and poems. In towns and villages people _ together in the evening to sing and play music. They also get together to read their own _ to each other.
